page.title: 07THE DEVIZES MOONRAKERS.
page.content: The most famous of Wiltshire tales is about the smugglers of Bishops Cannings. One gloomy night two smugglers met a boat carrying brandy. They were carrying the brandy through Devizes when they heard some excise men coming and became scared.They threw the brandy into the Crammer hoping to retrieve it later.That night they came back with big rakes and started to rake out the cask. Along came the excise men and asked the smugglers what they were doing. The smugglers thought quickly and they told the excise men that they were raking cheese from the Crammer. The moon was reflecting on the water so the excise men laughed and laughed as they rode off. All Wiltshire people have now adopted the name of Moonrakers.
